ygData.subject: Re: Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
ygData.msgSnippet: Depends on the size of the fireball now doesn t it?  Could be that fireball is about as annoying to the giant as a bic lighter!  And think of this, how much
ygData.messageBody:
Depends on the size of the fireball now doesn't it? Could be that fireball
is about as annoying to the giant as a bic lighter! And think of this, how
much damage can a pen knife do to you? Think you could be killed by one?

Now, we can look at EQ as a fantasy setting, or we can make it realistic.
If you want absolute realism, then yes, there is now way a single man with a
sword would be likely to kill a giant. In fact, to use your argument,
giants should be killing everyone with just on stomp, period. Not the 2 or
three it takes to kill me. We would also have to do away with that romantic
image of the Knight in shining armor slaying the Dragon with a single blow
from his sword or lance.

I tend to agree that they should probably have damage modifiers for HUGE
mobs that would reduce the base damage inflicted. These should be applied
to both physical weapons and spells though. Let's assume that base damage
is against med to large creatures. Of course, the reverse should hold true,
that smaller creature would receive more damage (all those elves, hobbits,
gnomes and dwarves beware!). This would make dragons and giants even
tougher then they are now, while making the combat with creatures of similar
size more realistic. I've seen what a broad sward can do, And like I said,
whether your head is cut off or you're reduced to ashes, your just as dead.

LefGrebo

Barb Warrior of Halas (Mith Marr)



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 2:53 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
>
>
> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>
>
> This arguement still doesn't make sense to me in a realm
> where some of the
> opponents are taller than houses.
>
> I don't care how big your axe is, you aren't going to be able
> to do the
> damage that a caster can to some creatures, like a hill giant.
>
> You argument just doesn't make sense when you apply it to the
> setting in EQ.
> Sure I can hack someone's head off in a single swipe and a
> mage could blast
> them to ashes. However, that same sword swipe will be nothing
> more than an
> annoyance to a giant, where that same fireball from the mage will do
> devastating damage.
>
> Making the warrior a huge damage dealing machine was never
> the intent of
> Verant and isn't in the spirit of EQ's balanced group oriented world.
> Verant needs to allow us to have an advantage of the other
> melee/caster
> hybrids is the main point of our discussion I think.
>
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Obergfell, Steven <SObergfell@...>
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com' <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, June 10, 1999 5:39 PM
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
>
>
> >From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
> >
> >Sorry, that last email was just too hard to read!!! Here it
> is again in
> >plain text!
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >I think the difference between melee combatants and casters
> magic should be
> >thus: Melee fighters should be able to do just as much
> damage, if not
> more,
> >whereas a caster may strike from a distance, and strike
> multiple targets
> >with area effect spells.
> >
> >I am the president of a national group that fights with live
> steel weapons.
> >I've been fighting with long swords, 2-handed swords, axes
> and maces for 10
> >years, and I am very comfortable with just how devastating
> these weapons
> can
> >be. No matter if you are struck by lightning or are cut in
> 2 by a large
> >axe, you are just as dead!
> >
> >So perhaps the direction we need to seek, and the difference
> between these
> 2
> >types of characters. melee and caster, is not how much
> damage they do, but
> >how. A caster should be able to reach far away, and strike multiple
> >targets, while the great warrior should only be able to strike at one
> target
> >at a time, but be able to mow them down like wheat.
> >
> >Oh, and if anyone is interested in an organization that
> allow you to wear
> >armor and swing a real blade ( and trust me, it will give
> you a whole new
> >perspective on your RPGing!) check out our website!
> >
> >www.adrianempire.org\
> >
